source.name: Moldova - Categories by Allocated amount
source.description:
The Category Schedule page allows World Bank clients to view a listing of all categories and sub-categories shown in the withdrawal schedule of the related Loan/Credit/Grant Agreements.  The Category Schedule provides a description of the items to be financed, the allocation of funds, the disbursed amount and the undisbursed balance for each category. 
The window opens with the amounts shown in the currency of commitment of the loan.  You may change the currency to US dollars (USD), Euros (EUR), Japanese Yen (JPY) or your local currency by selecting the desired currency from the "Show Amounts in" dropdown list.  Note that the amounts will be calculated using current exchange rates.

Information regarding Special Accounts is shown under a special category listed as SA-X (e.g., SA-*, SA-A) which has been created to keep track of advanced funds.  The disbursed amount under a Special Account shows the outstanding advance to the Special Account.  When the advances to the Special Account are being documented, the disbursed amount under the Special Account category reduces as the eligible expenditures are charged to related categories. When the Special Account is fully documented, both disbursed and undisbursed balances of the Special Account category become zero.  In some cases, a small balance in the Special Account category may exist after the Special Account is fully documented.  This represents the exchange rate fluctuation between the currency of commitment and the currency of the Special Account from the time of advances to the Special Account to the time of documentation of the Account. Financing Agreements with more details about the loan, credit, grant or trust fund are available here: http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/docsearch/country/82547 Search by Grant or Trust Fund Agreement and by Financing Agreement.

datasets.name: Health and Social Assistance Project
datasets.description:
This dataset represents the unaudited category schedule activity for the country of Moldova's current IBRD loans and IDA credits and grants. The Category Schedule is a view of all categories and sub-categories shown in the withdrawal schedule as agreed to in the related Loan/Credit/Grant Agreements.  The Category Schedule provides a description of the items to be financed, the allocation of funds, the disbursed amount and the undisbursed balance for each category. 

To facilitate comparison, all category schedule data in this dataset is shown in USD. However, the commitment currency of many loans/credits/grants may be in a currency other than USD.

Information regarding Designated Accounts is shown under a special category listed as DA-X (e.g., DA-*, DA-A) which has been created to keep track of advanced funds.  The disbursed amount under a Designated Account shows the outstanding advance to the Designated Account.  When the advances to the Designated Account are being documented, the disbursed amount under the Designated Account category reduces as the eligible expenditures are charged to related categories. Financing Agreements with more details about the loan, credit, grant or trust fund are available here: http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/docsearch/country/82547 .  TIP: Search by Grant or Loan Agreement and by Financing Agreement.

NOTE: This data is released as part of a pilot with the Government of Moldova and represents an unaudited snapshot as of the date on which this data was captured (see ???Data As Of??? date of this dataset). There are timing differences between the disbursements made by the Bank and when and how the funds are used for actual project expenditures.

datasets.name: Moldova Competitiveness Effectiveness Project - by Allocation Categories
datasets.description: For Moldova's Competitiveness Effectiveness Project (P089124), this visualization shows how IDA funds are allocated to expenditure categories vis a vis the Financing agreement. The two IDA credits and the IDA grant that fund this project are represented in this visualization. Note: Many projects are also funded by Trust Fund grants, which are not yet available on this dataset.

datasets.name: Moldova - Disbursements to current loans based on Allocations
datasets.description: For Current loans, credits, grants and trust funds in Moldova, the status of disbursements to expenditure categories in relation to what has been allocated to each category. The allocation schedule for individual loans are found in the loan/grant/credit agreement.
